results.title: Tesis [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Producciones del Escorpión S.L., Jose Luis Cuerda and Alejandro Amenabar
results.brief_description: Alejandro Amenabar’s debut thriller fittingly begins with our conflicted heroine Angela (Ana Torrent) witnessing the aftermath of a gruesome train suicide and then finding it difficult to look away. Tesis then proceeds to fashion an examination or thesis if you will on the nature of voyeurism and our compelling need ‘to look’. From this disquieting opening sequence we then move on to the films central stage, a film school in Madrid where Angela is writing a paper on violence in cinema and television. Her research leads her to the schools extensive audio visual library, where much to her horror she discovers a snuff movie catalogued away with the rest of the titles. When her tutor mysteriously dies (whom she discovers with the snuff movie in his possession), Angela enlists the help of fellow student and resident film geek Chema (Fele Martinez), whose obsessive taste for violent cinema makes him a suspect as well as her only ally in solving the crime. Things begin to get dangerous however when the pair realize that the girl tortured and murdered in the snuff movie is also a student at their school. Cast includes Eduardo Noriega, Xabier Elorriaga, Miguel Picazo, Nieves Herranz. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Terror by night
results.creator_credit: Universal Studios and Roy William Neill
results.brief_description: Sherlock Holmes and Watson find themselves aboard the London-Edinburgh Express, guarding the priceless “Star of Rhodesia” diamond. A series of murders leads them on a trail confused by disguise and impersonation. Starring Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce. Adapted from a story by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

results.title: Terminator 2: judgement day
results.creator_credit: Pacific Western, Lightstorm Entertainment and James Cameron
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Terminator”. The story resumes several years later in present day Los Angeles. A cybernetic assassin and bodyguard are sent back from the future. This time the target is John Connor (Edward Furlong), Sarah’s son. The story revolves around the conflict between two Terminators over the the boy’s life and ultimately the future of the human race. Arnold Schwarzenegger and Robert Patrick are suitably impressive and menacing as the two cyborgs, but in the words of James Cameron, the “real” terminator is Linda Hamilton as Sarah Connor. Her transformation from desperate prey, in the original film, to vigilante guerilla is rivetting. At the time of its release, “Terminator 2: Judgement Day” was the most expensive film ever made at a cost of $100 million. Fans of action adventure, mind-boggling special effects and wanton destruction will not be disappointed.

results.title: Terminal velocity
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Buena Vista, Scott Kroopf, Tom Engelman and Deran Sarafian
results.brief_description: All is not what it seems in this action thriller starring Charlie Sheen as the hard-playing reckless skydiving teacher, Ditch Brodie, who finds himself asking questions when his beautiful new student Chris Morrow (Nastassja Kinski) mysteriously meets with a tragic accident on her first jump. Suspense and intrigue follow as Brodie accused of manslaughter is caught up in international espionage involving the Russian mafia. Cast includes James Gandolfini, Chris McDonald.

results.title: Tender mercies
results.creator_credit: EMI/Parlophone, Antron Media, Horton Foote, Robert Duvall and Bruce Beresford
results.brief_description: A compassionate love story tracing the relationship between a burnt-out country and western star and a young widow he meets in a Texas motel. His past is littered with the spoils of fame and scarred by alcoholism, two broken marriages and a painful descent from stardom so that he lacks confidence in relationships and has a low opinion of himself and others. The widow and her young son help him to rebuild his life and to appreciate the healing power of affection. Stars Robert Duvall and Tess Harper.

results.title: Tender hooks
results.creator_credit: Tru-Vu Pictures, Chris Oliver and Mary Callaghan
results.brief_description: Mitch’s career as a hairdresser is nearing an end, but she remains optimistic and energetic. She meets Rex, charismatic, homeless and involved in schemes that result in his imprisonment. Mitch’s love for Rex survives his stay in prison, but when he escapes from custody, she is forced to confront the reality of their relationship and assume responsibility for her own future. Cinematography by Ray Argall. Cast includes Jo Kennedy, Nique Needles, Anna Phillips, Robert Menzies and John Polson.

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: the Movie (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Limelight Entertainment, Kim Dawson, Simon Fields, David Chan and Steve Barron
results.brief_description: The four baby turtles who strayed into radioactive waste and mutated to become human sized talking reptilians with a hearty appetite for pizzas and rock music were raised by the Japanese ninja master water rat Splinter in the sewers of New York City. Now the dreaded Shredder is recruiting teenagers to commit a wave of robberies which has the city in panic. So it’s up to the four fearless turtles to save the day with a little help from feisty TV reporter April. Cowabunga! Based on the comic-book creation of Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird.

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II: the secret of the ooze (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Gary Propper, Thomas K. Gray, Kim Dawson, David Chan and Michael Pressman
results.brief_description: The four hip superheroes Raphael, Leonardo, Michaelangelo and Donatello continue their bodacious adventures as they find a new sewer home and with the help of curvaceous TV reporter April O’Neil, Professor Jordon and Keno, the pizza delivery boy they battle the Foot gang and other mutant villains to discover their origins, to save New York and to keep the mutant-causing green ooze from falling into evil hands.

results.title: Tears of the black tiger = Fah talai jone
results.creator_credit: Aichi Arts Centre, Film Bangkok, Five Star Productions, Nonzee Nimibutr and Wisit Sasanatieng
results.brief_description: A story of ill-fated love between a peasant boy and a wealthy city girl; a film about the notorious “Black Tiger”, a Thai rural gang member with a touch of the Robin Hoods about him; and the story of how Black Tiger has to choose between love and the call of the outlaw past. So, obviously, the plot is ridiculous - but in this camp Western pastiche that doesn’t matter at all. A gloriously delirious subverting of the western genre, “Tears of the Black Tiger” features stunning colour cinematography which announces the film’s intention to be pure artifice and celebration of cinema as fantasy. The pleasures of the film are all to be found in the art direction, the music and the photography. It is also a homage to the camp excesses of “Duel in the sun” while also cheekily undermining the stoic Puritan heroes of the traditional western by lovingly detailing the homoeroticism that underlay so much of the masculine tension in the films of Ford, Hawks and the great Hollywood western directors. With Supakorn Kitsuwon, Arawat Ruangvuth, Sombati Medhanee and Apiroj Jaisinga.

results.title: Tea with Mussolini
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Medusa Film, Cattleya, Cineritmo, G2, Riccardo Tozzi, Giovanella Zannoni, Clive Parsons and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: Loosely based on his childhood, Zeffirelli weaves this enchanting tale with a gentle, loving hand. It is the story of a diverse group of cultured ladies, living in Florence in 1934, who meet for tea each afternoon. The group includes Lady Random (Maggie Smith), widow of the British ambassador to Italy, Arabella (Judy Dench) an artist and singer, Georgie (Lily Tomlin), an exuberant American archaeologist, and the brash and uninhibited Elsa (Cher). One of the ladies, Mary (Joan Plowright), becomes a surrogate mother to a young boy, Luca, and he is soon virtually adopted and brought up by the group. As Luca grows to become a man, the shifting political climate begins to have a devastating impact on the rarified world in which the ladies exist, and they must come to terms not only with their own mortality but also the inescapable passage of time.
